sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to the sixth unit of our English learning journey. Today, we'll explore the Past Continuous tense, expressed as 'I was doing.'

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: This tense helps us describe actions that were in progress at a specific point in the past. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: Formation
sections.content: The Present Simple tense is formed by using the base Subject + was/were + verb-ing
points: Usage of 'was' for singular subjects (I, he, she, it) and 'were' for plural subjects (you, we, they).
Usage of auxiliary verbs (did) in negative and interrogative sentences.
I was studying when the phone rang

sections.title: Usage
sections.content: Actions in Progress: Describe actions that were ongoing at a particular moment in the past
points: They were watching TV when I called.
Parallel Actions: Express two or more actions happening simultaneously in the past.
While she was cooking, he was cleaning

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of the Past Continuous tense:

examples.Positive: I was working on my project all afternoon
examples.Negative: We were not playing soccer at that time
examples.Interrogative: What were you doing when the lights went out?

sections.title: Time Expression
sections.content: Understanding time expressions is crucial for placing actions in the past continuous tense.
points: While, when, at that moment, at 3 PM yesterday

sections.title: Common Mistakes
sections.content: Address common mistakes to ensure learners use the past continuous tense accurately.
points: Incorrect:I was studying when he called.
Correct: 'I was studying when he called' (if the action was interrupted)

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, the Past Continuous tense helps us describe actions in progress at a specific moment in the past. Pay attention to the use of 'was' and 'were' and practice incorporating this tense into your storytelling

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring online exercises or referring to reliable grammar guides.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on the Past Continuous tense. Practice using it in various contexts, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
